page.title: 06New A38 motel at Barton
page.content: On 1st October 1985 a Little Chef Lodge was opened at Barton Turns. This is the first motel to be built by this ompany. It cost Â£255,000 and took about 6 months to complete. There are 20 rooms. 19 are ordinary bedrooms. A double room has a bathroom, double bed, double sofa bed and television. A family of four would use this type of room. The last room is for disabled people and has special features such as a larger bathroom, only 3 beds and a night call button connected to reception. The colour scheme is blue, white and pink. The charges are #19.50 per night for a single room and #24.50 for a double room. 10 people are now employed here as supervisors or cleaners. All meals are served at the restaurant on the other side of the car park. This facility is aimed at businessmen.
